Speaker: coral
Dialogue: Yes, Marlin. No, I see it. It's beautiful.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: So, Coral, when you said you wanted an ocean view, you didn't think that we we're gonna get the whole ocean, did you? Huh? [sighs] Oh yeah. A fish can breath out here. Did your man deliver or did he deliver?

Speaker: coral
Dialogue: Because a lot of other clownfish had their eyes on this place.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: You better believe they did--every single one of them.

Speaker: coral
Dialogue: Mm-hmm. You did good. And the neighborhood is awesome.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: So, you do like it, don't you?

Speaker: coral
Dialogue: No, no. I do, I do. I really do like it. But Marlin, I know that the drop off is desirable with the great schools and the amazing view and all, but do we really need so much space?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Coral, honey, these are our kids we're talking about. They deserve the best. Look, look, look. They'll wake up, poke their little heads out and they'll see a whale! See, right by their bedroom window.

Speaker: coral
Dialogue: Shhh, you're gonna wake the kids.

Speaker: coral
Dialogue: Aww, look. They're dreaming. We still have to name them.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: You wanna name all of 'em, right now? All right, we'll name this half Marlin Jr. and then this half Coral Jr. Okay, we're done.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Nemo? Well, we'll name one Nemo but I'd like most of them to be Marlin Jr.

Speaker: coral
Dialogue: Just think that in a couple of days, we're gonna be parents!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Yeah. What if they don't like me?

Speaker: coral
Dialogue: There's over 400 eggs. Odds are, one of them is bound to like you.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Well, I remember. 'Excuse me, miss, can you check and see if there's a hook in my lip?'

Speaker: coral
Dialogue: Marlin! 'Well, you gotta look a little closer because it's wiggling'.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Here he is. Cutie's here! Where did everybody go?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: [gasps] Coral, get inside the house, Coral. No, Coral, don't. They'll be fine. Just get inside, you, right now.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Ohh. There, there, there. It's okay, daddy's here. Daddy's got you. I promise, I will never let anything happen to you...Nemo.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: First day of school! First day of school! Wake up, wake up! C'mon, first day of school!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I don't wanna go to school. Five more minutes.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Get up, get up! It's time for school! It's time for school! It's time for school! It's time for school! Oh boy! Oh boy!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: [gasps] Nemo, don't move! Don't move! You'll never get out of there yourself. I'll do it. All right, where's the break? You feel a break?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Sometimes you can't tell 'cause fluid is rushing to the area. Now, any rushing fluids?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: How many stripes do I have?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No! See, something's wrong with you. I have one, two, three--that's all I have? Oh, you're okay. How's the lucky fin?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Are you sure you wanna go to school this year? 'Cause there's no problem if you don't. You can wait 5 or 6 years.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Come on, dad. It's time for school.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Do you want this anemone to sting you?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: There. Ha ha! Right there. And here and here and here!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: All right, we're excited. First day of school, here we go. We're ready to learn to get some knowledge. Now, what's the one thing we have to remember about the ocean?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: That's my boy. So, first we check to see that the coast is clear. We go out and back in. And then we go out, and back in. And then one more time--out and back in. And sometimes, if you wanna do it four times--

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Dad, maybe while I'm at school, I'll see a shark! I highly doubt that.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Have you ever met a shark?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, and I don't plan to.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Sandy Plankton from next door, he said that sea turtles, said that they live to be about a hundred years old!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Well, you know what, if I ever meet a sea turtle, I'll ask him. After I'm done talking to the shark, okay? Whoa, whoa, whoa! Hold on, hold on, wait to cross. Hold my fin, hold my fin.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Dad, you're not gonna freak out like you did at the petting zoo, are you?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Hey, that snail was about to charge. Hmm, I wonder where we're supposed to go.

Speaker: fish mom
Dialogue: I'll pick you up after school.

Speaker: crab kid
Dialogue: Come on, you guys. Stop it! Give it back!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Come on, we'll try over there.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Excuse me, is this where we meet his teacher?

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Well, look who's out of the anemone.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: Bill. Hey, you're a clownfish. You're funny, right? Hey, tell us a joke.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Well, actually, that's a common misconception. Clownfish are no funnier than any other fish.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: All right, I   know one joke. Um, there's a mollusk, see? And he walks up to a sea, well he doesn't walk   up, he swims up. Well, actually the mollusk isn't moving. He's in one place and then the   sea cucumber, well they--I mixed up. There was a mollusk and a sea cucumber. None of them   were walking, so forget that I--

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Sheldon! Get out of Mr. Johansenn's yard, now!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Dad, dad...can I go play too? Can I?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I would feel better if you go play over on the sponge beds.

Speaker: sheldon
Dialogue: Ow! Hey, what'd I do? What'd I do?

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Be nice. It's his first time at school.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: He was born with it, kids. We call it his lucky fin.

Speaker: pearl
Dialogue: See this tentacle? It's actually shorter than all my other tentacles but you can't really tell.Especially when I twirl them like this.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Whoa, you better stay with me.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Just so you know, he's got a little fin. I find if he's having trouble swimming, let him take a break. Ten, fifteen minutes.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Dad, it's time for you to go now.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Hey, you're doing pretty well for a first timer.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Well, you can't hold onto them forever, can you?

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: Yeah, I had a tough time when my oldest went out at the drop off.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: They just gotta grow up--the drop off?! They're going to the drop off?! Wh-what are you, insane?! Why don't we fry 'em up now and serve them with chips!?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Don't tell me to be calm, pony boy!

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: You know for a clownfish, he really isn't that funny.

Speaker: pearl
Dialogue: Aw, you guys made me ink.

Speaker: tad
Dialogue: I know what that is. Oh, oh! Sandy Plankton saw one. He called, he said it was called a...a butt.

Speaker: pearl
Dialogue: Wow. That's a pretty big butt.

Speaker: sheldon
Dialogue: Oh, look at me. I'm gonna go touch the butt. [sneezes] Whoa!

Speaker: sheldon
Dialogue: Oh yeah? Let's see you get closer.

Speaker: tad
Dialogue: Come on, Nemo. How far can you go?

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Uh, my dad says it's not safe.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: You were about to swim into open water!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: No, I wasn't go out--but dad!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: It was a good thing I was here. If I hadn't showed up, I don't know--

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: This does not concern you, kids. And you're lucky I don't tell your parents you were out there. You know you can't swim well.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: I can swim fine, dad, okay?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, it's not okay. You shouldn't be anywhere near here. Okay, I was right. You'll start school in a year or two.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: No, dad! Just because you're scared of the ocean--

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Clearly, you're not ready. And you're not coming back until you are. You think you can do these things but you just can't, Nemo!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to interrupt things. He isn't a good swimmer and it's a little too soon for him to be out here unsupervised.

Speaker: fish kid
Dialogue: Oh my gosh! Nemo's swimming out to sea!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Nemo! What do you think you're doing? You're gonna get stuck out there and I'll have to get you before another fish does! Get back here! I said get back here, now! Stop! You take one move, mister. Don't youdare! If you put one fin on that boat..are you listening to me? Don't touch the bo--Nemo!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: You paddle your little tail back here, Nemo. That's right. You are in big trouble, young man. Do you hear me? Big...big--

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Oh! Nemo! Unh! Nemo! Nemo, no! Nemo! Nemo! Nemo! No! No! Aah! Nemo! Nemo!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Oh no. No, no. It's gone, it's gone. No, no, it can't be gone. No, no! Nemo! Nemo! Nemo! No! Nemo! Nemo! No! No, please, no! No, no!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Has anybody seen a boat!? Please! A white boat! They took my son! My son! Help me, please!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Ohh. Oh, oh. Sorry! I didn't see you. Sir, are you okay?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, no. They took him away. I have to find the boat.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: It passed by not too long ago.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Oh, oh, oh! It-it went, um, this way! And it went this way! Follow me!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: I'm trying to swim here. What, ocean ain't big enough for you?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: You got a problem, buddy? Huh? Huh? Do 'ya? Do 'ya? Do 'ya? You want a piece of me? Yeah, oooh, I'm scared now. Whaat!?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: What? You're showing me which way the boat went!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: A boat? Hey, I've seen a boat. It passed by not too long ago. It went this way, it went this way. Follow me!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Wait a minute, wait a minute! What is going on? You already told me which way the boat was going!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: If this is some kind of practical joke, it's not funny! And I know funny..I'm a clownfish!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: No, it's not. I know it's not. I'm so sorry. See, I suffer from short-term memory loss.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Short-term memory loss..I don't believe this!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: No, it's true. I forget things almost instantly. It runs in my family..or at least I think it does. Hmmm..where are they? Can I help you?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Something's wrong with you, really. You're wasting my time. I have to find my son. [gasps]

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Name's Bruce. It's all right, I understand. Why trust a shark, right? So, what's a couple of bites like you doing out so late, eh?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Nothing. We're not doing anything. We're not even out.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Great! Then how'd you morsels like to come to a little get-together I'm havin'?

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, that's right--a party! What do you say?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Ooh, I love parties! Parties are fun!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Parties are fun, and it's tempting but--

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Hey, look--balloons! It is a party!

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Ha ha ha! Mind your distance, though. Those balloons can be a bit dodgy. You wouldn't want one of them to pop.

Speaker: chum
Dialogue: We've already gone through all the snacks and I'm still starvin'!

Speaker: anchor
Dialogue: We almost had a feeding frenzy.

Speaker: chum
Dialogue: Come on, let's get this over with.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Right, then. The meeting has officially come to order. Let us all say the pledge..

Speaker: chum
Dialogue: Dolphins! Yeah, they think they're sooo cute! 'Hey, look at me. I'm a flippin' little dolphin! Let me flip for 'ya! Ain't I a somethin'!'

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Right, then. Today's meeting is step 5, 'BRING A FISH FRIEND'. Now do you all have your friends?

Speaker: chum
Dialogue: Oh, um, I seem to have misplaced my uh, friend.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: That's all right, Chum. I had a feeling this would be a difficult step, you can help yourself to one of my friends.

Speaker: chum
Dialogue: Oh, thanks, mate. A little chum for Chum, eh?

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: I'll start the testimonies. Hello, my name is Bruce.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: It has been three weeks since my last fish, on my honor, or may I be chopped up and made into soup.

Speaker: chum
Dialogue: You're an inspiration to all of us.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Yes, the little Sheila down the front.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: And, uh, well, I don't think I've ever eaten a fish.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Whew! I'm glad I got that off my chest.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: All right, anyone else? Hello, how 'bout you, mate? What's your problem?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Me? I don't have a problem.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Okay. Uh, hello. My name is Marlin. I'm a clownfish--

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Go on, tell us a joke!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Actually I do know one that's pretty good. There was this mollusk and he walks up to a sea cucumber. Normally, they don't talk, sea cucumbers, but in a joke, everyone talks. So the sea mollusk says to the cucumber...

Speaker: chum
Dialogue: Nemo! Ha ha ha! Nemo! I don't get it.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: For a clownfish, he's not that funny.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, no, no, no. He's my son. He was taken by these divers.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Now there is a father looking for his little boy.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Ugh! What do these markings mean?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Well then we gotta find a fish who can read this. Hey, look. Sharks!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: That's mine! Give it to me! Gimme! Oww!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry. Are you okay?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: You really clocked me there. Am I bleeding?

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Dory, are you oka--oohh. Oohh, that's good.

Speaker: chum
Dialogue: Remember, Bruce, fish are friends, not food!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: There's no way out! There's got to be a way to escape!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Dory, help me find a way out!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Sorry, you'll have to come back later. We're trying to escape.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: There's gotta be a way out!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Look, here's something! 'ESSS-CA-PE'! I wonder what that means. It's funny, it's spelled just like the word 'escape'.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: I can read? That's right, I can read!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Well, then here. Read this now!

Speaker: anchor
Dialogue: He really doesn't mean it, y'know! He never even knew his father!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I need to get that mask!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, no, no, no, no, no!

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: Prep for his anterior crown, would you, please? And I'm going to need a few cotton rolls.

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: Heh heh heh! Beauty, isn't he? I found that guy struggling for life out on the reef and I saved him. So, has that novocaine kicked in yet?

Speaker: patient
Dialogue: I think so. We're ready to roll.

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: Heh heh! Slow down, little fella. There's nothing to worry about.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: I wanna go home. Do you know where my dad is?

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Honey, your dad's probably back at the pet store.

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: Yeah, you know, like I'm from Bob's Fish Mart.

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: Ah, the ocean. The ocean! Aaah! He hasn't been decontaminated yet! Jacques!

Speaker: jacques
Dialogue: Ooh, la mer. Bon. Voila. He is clean.

Speaker: bubbles
Dialogue: Wow. The big blue. What's it like?

Speaker: deb
Dialogue: Kid, if there's anything you need, just ask your auntie Deb, that's me. Or if I'm not around, you can always talk to my sister Flo. Hi,how are you? Don't listen to anything my sister says, she's nuts! Ha ha ha ha!

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: I said we got a live one.

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: Oh boy, oh boy, oh boy, oh boy!

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Root canal, and by the looks of those x-rays it's not gonna be pretty.

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: What did he use to open?

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Gator-Glidden drill. He seems to be favoring that one lately.

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Now he's doing the Schilder technique.

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: Oooh, he's using a Hedstrom file.

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: That's not a Hedstrom file. That's a K-Flex.

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: It's got a teardrop cross-section. Clearly a Hedstrom.

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: Hedstro--! [inflates] There I go. A little help over here.

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: All right, go ahead and rinse.

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: Ugh! The human mouth is a disgusting place.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: What did I miss? Am I late?

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Root canal and it's a doozy.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Root canal, eh? What did he use to open?

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: He seems to be favoring that one. Hope he doesn't get surplus sealer at the portal terminus... hello.

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: The dentist took him off the reef.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: An outie. From my neck of the woods, eh? Sorry if I ever took a snap at you. Fish gotta swim, birds gotta eat. [gasps]

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: Hey! No, no,   no, no! They're not your fish. They're my fish. Come on, go! Go on, shoo! Oh, the picture   broke. This here's Darla. She's my niece. She's going to be eight next week. Hey, little   fella. Say hello to your new mummy. She'll be here Friday to pick you up. You're her present.   Shh, shh, shh! It's our little secret. Well, Mr. Tucker, while that sets up I'm going to   see a man about a wallaby.

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: She wouldn't stop shaking the bag.

Speaker: deb
Dialogue: He was her present last year.

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: Hitched a ride on the porcelain express.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: I can't go with that girl! I have to get back to my dad! Aaah! Daddy! Help me!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: No. You got yourself in there, you can get yourself out.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: I just wanna see him do it, okay? Calm down. Alternate wiggling your fins and your tail.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: I can't. I have a bad fin.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Just think about what you need to do.

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Wow. From the ocean. Just like you, Gill.

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: I've seen that look before. What are you thinking about?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: I'm thinking, tonight, we give the kid a proper reception.

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: So kid, you got a name or what?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Are you gonna eat that? Careful with that hammer...

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Huh? No, no! What does it say? Dory!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Wake up! Get up! Come on! Come on!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Look out! Sharks eat fish! Aaaaaah!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: [gasps] The mask! Where's the mask? No! No, not the mask! Get it! Get the mask! Get the mask! Get it!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: [singing] Hoo doot doo doot doot doo doot. Whoo-hoo! La la la la la la. Just keeps going on, doesn't it? Echo! Echo! Hey, what are you doing?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: It's gone. I've lost the mask.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: You dropped it! That was my only chance of finding my son, now it's gone.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Hey, Mr. Grumpy Gills. When life gets you down, you know what you gotta do?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I don't wanna know what you gotta do when life gets you down.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: [singing] Just keep swimming. Just keep swimming, swimming, swimming. What do we do? We swim, swim.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: [singing] Ho ho ho ho ho ho! I love to swim! When you want to swim..

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: See, I'm going to get stuck now with that song now it's in my head!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Who could it be? It's me!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah. I'm your conscience. We haven't spoken for a while. How are you?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Yeah? Good. Now, Dory. I want you to tell me..do you see anything?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Yeah. Over there. Hey, conscience. Am I dead?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, I see it too. What is it?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I'm feeling...happy. Which is a big deal for me.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: I want to touch it. Oh!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Hey, come back. Come on back here.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: [singing] I'm gonna get you. I'm gonna get you. I'm gonna swim with you.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I'm gonna get you. I'm gonna be your best friend...good feeling's gone.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I can't see! I don't know where I'm going!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Okay, I can't see a thing.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: I'm sorry, but if you could just bring it a little closer, I kind of need the light. That's great, keep it right there.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Okay, okay. Mr. Bossy. Uh, 'P'. Okay, 'P'. 'Shh-eer...Sher--P. Sher--P. Shirley? P.--'. Oh! The first line's 'P. Sherman'!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: P. Sherman doesn't make any sense!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Don't eat me! Don't eat me! Aaaah!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: That's great! Speed read! Take a guess! No pressure! No problem! There's a lot of pressure! Pressure! Take a guess now with pressure!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I'm dead, I'm dead, I'm dead, I'm dead, I'm dead, I died, I'm dead.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Whoo-hoo! [singing] We did it, we did it! Oh yeah, yeah, yeah! No eating here tonight, whoo!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: [singing] No, no, no eating here tonight. You on a diet--

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Dory! What did the mask say?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: 'P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney'. [gasps] I remember what it said! I usually forget things, but I remembered it this time!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, wait! Where is that?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: I don't know. But who cares? I remembered!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. I remembered it again!

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: Nemo! Newcomer of orange and white, you have been called forth to the summit of Mount Wannahockaloogie to join with us in the fraternal bonds of tankhood.

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: We want you in our club, kid.

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: If you are able to swim through..THE RING OF FIRE! [whispers to Jacques] Turn on the Ring of Fire! The Ring of Fire, you said you could do it--THE RING OF FIRE!

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Isn't there another way? He's just a boy!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: From this moment on, you will now be known as Sharkbait.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Okay, Sharkbait's one of us now, agreed?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: We can't send him off to his death. Darla's coming in 5 days, so what are we gonna do? I'll tell you what we're gonna do: we're gonna get him outta here. We're gonna help him escape.

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: Gill, please, not another one of your escape plans.

Speaker: deb
Dialogue: Sorry, but they, they just, they never work.

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: Yeah. Why should this be any different?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: You're the only one who can get in and out of that thing. What we need you to do is take a pebble inside and jam the gears. You do that and this tank's gonna get filthier and filthier by the minute. Pretty soon, the dentist'll have to clean the tank himself. And when he does, he'll take us out of the tank, put us in the individual baggies, then we roll ourselves down the counter, out of the window, off the awning, into the bushes, across the street and into the harbor! It's foolproof! Who's with me?

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: No offense, kid, but, um..you're not the best swimmer.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: He's fine, he can do this. So Sharkbait, what do you think?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: I'm going to P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. Where are you going? I'm going to P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. If you're askin' where I'm goin'. I'll tell you that's where I'm going. It's P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. Where? I'm sorry, I didn't hear you. P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way...

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Excuse me. Ex-excuse me, um, hi. Do you know how to get to--hello? W-w-w-wait! Can you tell me--hey! Hold it! Wait a minute! I'm trying to talk to you. Okay, fellas, come back here. Please, one quick question. I need to aaaaand they're gone again. [sighs]

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: P. Sherman 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. Why do I have to tell you over and over again? I'll tell you again. I don't get tired of it--

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Y'know, I just, I-I think it's best if I just, if I just, carry on from here by..by myself.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Without, without..well, I mean, not without you. I mean, it's just that I don't want you... with me.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I don't wanna hurt your feelings..

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Well, I mean not..yes, yeah. It's just that you know I-I just can't afford anymore delays and you're one of those fish that cause delays. And sometimes it's a good thing. There's a whole group of fish. They're..'delay fish'.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: You mean..[whimper]you mean you don't..like me? [sobs]

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, of course I like you. It's because I like you I don't wanna be with you. It's a complicated emotion. Oh, don't cry. I like you.

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: Hey, you! Lady, is this guy botherin' you?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Um, I don't remember. Were you?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, no, no, no, no. We're just, we're..hey, do you guys know how I can get to--

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: Look, pal. We're talkin' to the lady, not you. Hey-hey, you like impressions?

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: Okay. Just like in rehearsals, gentlemen. So, what are we? Take a guess.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Oh, oh, I've seen one of those.

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: I'm a fish with a nose like a sword.

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: Hey, clown boy! Let the lady guess. Where's the butter?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Oh-oh-oh! It's on the tip of my tongue.

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: Lots of legs, lives in the ocean.

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: Close enough. [singing] Oh, it's a whale of a tale, I'll tell you lad, a whale of a tale.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Will somebody please give me directions?

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: [impersonating Marlin] Will somebody please give me directions?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Oh dear. Hey, hey come back! Hey, what's the matter?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: What's the matter? While they're doing their silly little impressions, I am miles from home, with a fish that can't even remember her own name.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Yeah. Meanwhile my son is out there.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: But it doesn't matter, 'cause no fish in this entire ocean is gonna help me.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Well, I'm helping you. Wait right here. Hey, guys.

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: What, is he bothering you again?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: No, no, he's a good guy. Go easy on him, he's lost his son, Fabio. Any of you heard of P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney?

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: Sydney? Oh sure. Why, Ted here's got relatives in Sydney. Don't you, Ted?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: You wouldn't know how to get there, would you?

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: What you wanna do is follow the EAC, that's the East Australian Current. Big current, can't miss it, it's in..that direction. And then you gotta follow that for about, I don't know, what do you guys think? About three leagues? And that little baby's gonna put you right past Sydney.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Great! That's great! Dory, you did it!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Oh, please. I'm just your little helper. Helping along, that's me.

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: Don't mention it. And, uh, loosen up. Okay, buddy?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Oh, you guys. You really nailed him. Bye.

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: Oh, hey ma'am, one more thing.

Speaker: moonfish leader
Dialogue: When you come to this trench, swim through it, not over it.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Trench, through it, not over it. I'll remember. Hey, hey! Hey! Hey! Hey, wait up, partner. Hold on. Wait! Wait-wait! I got, I gotta tell you something..whoa. Nice trench. Hello! Okay, let's go.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Bad trench, bad trench. Come on, we're gonna swim over this thing.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, partner. Little red flag goin' up. Somethin's telling me we should swim through it, not over it.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Are you even looking at this thing? It's got death written all over it.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: I'm sorry, but I really, really, really think we should swim through.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: And I'm really, really done talking about this. Over we go.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Come on, trust me on this.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Yes, trust. It's what friends do.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Oh, it just swam over the trench. Come on, we'll follow it.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Boy, sure is clear up here.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Exactly. And look at that, there's the current. We should be there in no time.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: You wanted to go through the trench.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: I shall call him Squishy and he shall be mine and he shall be my Squishy. Come here, Squishy. Come here, little Squishy. [Baby talk]---oww!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Shoo! Shoo, shoo! Get away! Come here, let me see.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Don't touch it! Don't touch it!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I'm not gonna touch it. I just wanna look.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Heeey, how come it didn't sting you?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: ..hold still. I live in this anemone and I'm, I'm, I'm used to these kind of stings. Come here.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: It doesn't look bad, you're gonna be fine. But now we know, don't we?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: That we don't wanna touch these again. Let's be thankful this time it was just a little one.[gasps]

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Don't move! This is bad, Dory.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Dory! Don't bounce on the tops! They will..not sting you. The tops don't sting you, that's it!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Ooh! Two in a row, beat that.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Dory! All right, listen to me. I have an idea, a game.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Aah! I love games! Pick me!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: All right, here's the game. Um, whoever can hop the fastest out of these jellyfish, wins.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: You can't touch the tentacles, only the tops.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Something about tentacles, got it. On your mark, get set, go!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: W-wait! Wait! Not something about them, it's all about them! Wait!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Gotta go faster if you wanna win!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: So, we're cheating death now. That's what we're doin'. We're havin' fun at the same time. I can do this, just be careful.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Yeah, careful I don't make you cry when I win!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Ha ha ha ha! Whooo! Give it up, old man. You can't fight evolution, I was built for speed.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: The question is, Dory, are you hungry?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Yeah, 'cause you're about to eat my bubbles! Duck to the left! Right there! The clownfish is the winner! Woohoo! We did it! We're gonna...Dory? Oh no. Dory! Dory! Dory! [gasps] Dory! Uggghhh!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, you're doing fine! You're, you're actually winning! But you gotta stay awake. Uh, where does P. Sherman live?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: That's it! Oww! Ow! Stay awake! Stay awake! Ow! Stay awake! Stay--awake!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: You miss your dad, don't you, Sharkbait?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Well, you're lucky to have someone out there who's lookin' for you.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: He's not looking for me. He's scared of the ocean.

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: He's had at least four cups of coffee, it's gotta be soon.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: My first escape, landed on dental tools. I was aimin' for the toilet.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: All drains lead to the ocean, kid.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Wow. How many times have you tried to get out?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Aah, I've lost count. Fish aren't meant to be in a box, kid. It does things to 'ya.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Okay, you gotta be quick. Once you get in, you swim down to the bottom of the chamber and I'll talk you through the rest.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Go on, it'll be a piece of kelp.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Nicely done! Can you hear me?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Here comes the pebble. Now, do you see a small opening?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Okay, inside it you'll see a rotating fan. Very carefully, wedge that pebble into the fan to stop it turning.

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Gill, this isn't a good idea.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: That's it, Sharkbait. Nice and steady.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: I got it! I got it!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: That's great, kid! Now, swim up the tube and out.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Get 'im outta there! Get 'im outta there!

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: What do we do!? What do we do!?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Stay calm, kid! Just don't panic!

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Gill, don't make him go back in there.

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Oh, saw the whole thing, dude. First you were like, 'whoa'! And then we were all like, 'whoa'! And then you were like, 'whoa'.

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: You, mini-man. Takin' on the jellies. You got serious thrill issues, dude.

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Oh, man. No hurlin' on the shell, dude, okay, just waxed it.

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Whoa, dude. Mr. Turtle is my father. Name's Crush.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Crush? Really? Okay Crush, listen I need to get to the East Australian Current. EAC?

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Ha ha ha, dude, ha ha, you're ridin' it, dude! Check it out!

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: So, what brings you on this fine day to the EAC?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Well, Dory and I need to get to Sydney. [gasps] Dory! Dory! Is she all right!?

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Oh. Oh, Little Blue. She is sub-level, dude.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Oh, Dory. I-I-I'm so sorry. This is all my fault, it's my fault...

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: ..29, 30! Ready or not, here I come! There you are! Catch me if you can! Ha ha! Ha ha ha ha!

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Whoa. Kill the motor, dude. Let us see what Squirt does flying solo.

Speaker: squirt
Dialogue: Whoa! Whoa! That was so cool! Hey dad, did you see that? Did you see me? Did you see what I did?

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: You so totally rock, Squirt! So give me some fin..noggin..

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Oh, intro. Jellyman, Offspring. Offspring, Jellyman.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Well, apparently, I must've done something you all like. Heh, uh, dudes.

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Curl away, my son. Aw, it's awesome, Jellyman. Little dudes are just eggs, leave 'em on the beach to hatch, then coo-coo-ca-choo, they find their way back to the big 'ol blue.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: But-but-but dude, how do you know when they're ready?

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Well, you never really know. But when they'll know, you'll know, you know? Ha.

Speaker: squirt
Dialogue: I know that dude. It's the Jellyman.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Well, go on, jump on him.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Hold on, I need to breath--

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Sorry. I was a little vague on the details.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Well, you see my son was taken. My son was taken away from me.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, no, no, kids. I don't wanna talk about it.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: [sighs] Well, okay. I live on this reef, a long long way from here.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Oh, boy. This is gonna be good, I can tell.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: And my son,   Nemo, see he was mad at me. And maybe he wouldn't have done it if I hadn't been so tough on   him, I don't know. Anyway, he swam out in the open water to this boat and when he was out   there, these divers appeared and I tried to stop them but the boat was too fast. So we swam   out in the ocean to follow them...

Speaker: turtle kid
Dialogue: They couldn't stop them. And then Nemo's dad, he swims out to the ocean and they bump into..

Speaker: small fish
Dialogue: ..three ferocious sharks! He scares away the sharks by blowin' them up!

Speaker: lobster
Dialogue: ..feet straight down into the dark. It's like wicked dark down there, you can see a thing. How's it goin', Bob? And the only thing that they can see down there..

Speaker: swordfish
Dialogue: ..is the light from this big horrible creature with razor sharp teeth. Nice parry, old man. And then he has to blast his way...

Speaker: dolphin
Dialogue: So, these two little fish have been..searching the ocean for days. On the East Australian Current.

Speaker: female bird
Dialogue: Which means that he may be on his way here right now. That should put them in Sydney..

Speaker: gulls
Dialogue: Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine!

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Oh, would you just shut up! You're rats with wings!

Dialogue: ..bloke's been lookin' for his boy Nemo.

Speaker: pelican
Dialogue: He was taken off the reef by divers and this..

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Hey, hey, hey! Say that again! You said something about Nemo. What was it?

Speaker: pelican
Dialogue: Last I heard, he's headin' towards the harbor.

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: I don't know, but whatever you do, don't mention D-A-R..

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: It's okay, I know who you're talking about.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: I'm sorry I couldn't stop the--

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: No, I'm the one who should be sorry. I was so ready to get out, so ready to taste that ocean. I was willing to put you in harm's way to get there. Nothing should be worth that. I'm sorry I couldn't get you back to your father, kid.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: All right! Hey, hey, hey, hey--!

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: Well, uh, that's one way to pull a tooth. He he he he he! Huh, darn kids. Well, good thing I pulled the right one, eh, prime minister? He he he he!

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Oh, Nigel. You just missed an extraction.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Ooh! Has he loosened the periodontal ligament yet--oh, what I'm talkin' about!? Nemo! Where's Nemo? I gotta speak with him.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Your dad's been fighting the entire ocean looking for you.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Oh yeah. He's travelled hundreds of miles. He's been battling sharks and jellyfish and all sorts of--

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Are you sure? What was his name? Some sort of sportfish or something: tuna, uh, trout..

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: That's it! Marlin! The little clownfish from the reef.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: It's my dad! He took on a shark!

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: I heard he took on three.

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: That's gotta be forty eight hundred teeth!

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: You see, kid, after you were taken by diver Dan over there, your dad followed the boat you were on like a maniac.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: He's swimming and   he's swimming and he's giving it all he's got and then three gigantic sharks capture him   and he blows them up! And then dives thousands of feet and gets chased by a monster with   huge teeth! He ties this demon to a rock and what does he get for a reward? He gets to   battle an entire jellyfish forest! And now he's riding with a bunch of sea turtles on   the East Australian Current and the word is he's headed this way right now, to Sydney!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: He was lookin' for you after all, Sharkbait.

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: You've got your whole life ahead of you!

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: Come on, kid! Grab the end!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Can you hear me, Sharkbait!? Nemo! Can you hear me!?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Everybody else, be as gross as possible. Think dirty thoughts. We're gonna make this tank so filthy, the dentist'll have to clean it.

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: All right, we're here, dudes! Get ready! Your exit's comin' up, man!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Right there! I see it! I see it!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: You mean the swirling vortex of terror!?

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Okay, first: find your exit buddy!

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Do you have your exit buddy?

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Okay, Squirt here will now give you a rundown of proper exiting technique!

Speaker: squirt
Dialogue: Good afternoon, we're gonna have a great jump today! Okay, crank a hard cutback as you hit the wall! There's a screaming bottom turn, so watch out! Remember: rip it, roll it and punch it!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: It's like he's trying to speak to me, I know it! You know, you're really cute! But I don't know what you're saying! Say the first thing again!

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Okay, Jellyman! Go, go, go, go, go, go!

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Ha ha! Most excellent! Now, turn your fishy tails 'round and swim straight on through to Sydney! No worries, man!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No worries! Thank you, dude Crush!

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: You tell your little dude I said 'hi', okay?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Oh, Nemo would've loved this. Hey, ooh! Hey, Crush! Crush, I forgot! How old are you?

Speaker: crush
Dialogue: Hundred and fifty, dude! And still young! Rock on!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Hundred and fifty! Hundred and fifty, I gotta remember that.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Yup. We're gonna just swim straight.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: [singing] Just keep swimming, just keep swimming.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Boy, this is taking a while.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Hey, how about we play a game?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Uh, okay. I'm thinking of something, uh, orange. And it's small..

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Me. And the next one's just a guess: me.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: W-w-wait, I have definitely seen this floating speck before. That means we've passed it before and that means we're going in circles and that means we're not going straight!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: We gotta get to the surface, come on! Let's figure it out up there. Let's go! Follow me! Wha--?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Hey! Relax. Take a deep breath. Now, let's ask somebody for directions.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Oh, fine. Who do you wanna ask, the speck? There's nobody here!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Well, there has to be someone. It's the ocean, silly, we're not the only two in here. Let's see...okay, no one there. Uhh, nope. Nada. [gasps] There's somebody. Hey! Excuse--

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Dory! Dory! Dory! Okay, now it's my turn. I'm thinking of something dark and mysterious. It's a fish we don't know. And if we ask it directions, it could ingest us and spit out our bones!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: What is it with men and asking for directions?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Look, I don't wanna play the gender card right now. You wanna play a card? Let's play the 'Let's Not Die' card.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: You wanna get outta here, don't you?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Well then, how are we gonna do that unless we give it a shot and hope for the best? Hmmm? Hmmmm!? Come on, trust me on this.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Excuse me! Woohoo! Little fella? Hello. Don't be rude, say 'hi'.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Dory, I'm a little fella. I don't think that's a little fella.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Oh. Oh, oh, big fella. Big fe--whale. Okay. Maybe he only speaks whale. MOOOOO-WEEEEEEE-NEEEEED...

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Are you sure you speak whale?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Dory! Heaven knows what you're saying! See, he's swimming away.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: He's not coming back. You offended him.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Maybe a different dialect. MOOOOOOOOOOOOOO! MOOOOOAAAAAAAAAA..!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Dory. Dory, this is not whale. You're speaking like..upset stomach.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Too much orca. Didn't it sound a little orca-ish?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: It doesn't sound orca! It sounds like nothing I've ever heard!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: It's just as well, he might be hungry.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Don't worry. Whales don't eat clownfish, they eat krill.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Look at that. Would you look at that? Filthy. Absolutely filthy. And it's all thanks to you, kid. You made it possible. Jacques, I said no cleaning!

Speaker: deb
Dialogue: Flo! Flo! Has anybody seen Flo? Flo!

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Nine o' clock and cue dentist.

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Okay. Okay, here we go. Here we go, okay.

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Okay. Walks to the counter, drops the keys..

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: Eww! Don't you people realize we are swimming in our own--

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: Crikey, what a state. Oh. Barbara, what's my earliest appointment tomorrow?

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: Leave it open, would you? I gotta clean the fish tank before Darla gets here.

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: He he! Did you hear that, Sharkbait?

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Yay! He's gonna clean the tank! He's gonna clean the tank! We're gonna be clean!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Are you ready to see your dad, kid?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Of course you are. Y'know, I wouldn't be surprised if he's out there in the harbor waitin' for you right now.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Here comes a big one--whooooooo! Come on, you gotta try this!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: We're in a whale! Don't you get it!?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: A whale! 'Cause you had to ask for help! And now we're stuck here!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Wow. A whale. You know I speak whale.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, you're insane! You can't speak whale! I have to get out! I have to find my son! I have to tell him how old sea turtles are! [sobs]

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: There, there. It's all right. It'll be okay.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No. I promised him I'd never let anything happen to him.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Huh. That's a funny thing to promise.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Well, you can't never let anything happen to him. Then nothing would ever happen to him. Not much fun for little Harpo.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: I don't know. I'll ask him. MMMWWHAAAAAAAAA! HUUUWHAAAAAAAAA..

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: I think he says we've stopped.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Of course, we've stopped. Just stop trying to speak whale, you're gonna make things worse. [gasps] What is that noise? Oh no. Look what you did. The water's going down! It's-it's-it's going down!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Okay, that one was a little tougher. He either said we should go to the back of the throat or he wants a root beer float.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Of course he wants us to go there! That's eating us! How do I taste, Moby!? Huh!? Do I taste good!? You tell him I'm not interested in being lunch!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No! No more whale! You can't speak whale!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, you can't! You think you could do these things but you can't, Nemo!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: He says it's time to let go! Everything's gonna be all right!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Look! Sy-d-ney..Sydney! Uh, Sydney! Sydney again!

Dialogue: You were right, Dory! We made it! We're gonna find my son!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Wow. I wish I could speak whale.

Dialogue: Okay. All we gotta do is find the boat that took him.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Come on, Dory. We can do this!

Dialogue: [yawn] Morning. [gasps] It's morning, everyone! Today's the day! The sun is shining, the tank is clean and we are getting out of--[gasps]--the tank is clean. The tank is clean!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Boss must've installed it last night while we were sleepin'.

Dialogue: 'The AquaScum 2003 is an all-purpose, self-cleaning maintenance free salt water purifier that is guaranteed to even extend the life of your aquarium fish'.

Dialogue: 'The AquaScum is programmed to scan your tank environment every 5 minutes'?

Dialogue: That's it for the escape plan. It's ruined!

Dialogue: Then what're we gonna do about--

Dialogue: My nerves can't take much more of this.

Dialogue: Swim down! Come on, kid! Swim down! Come on!

Dialogue: Whoops. That would've been a nasty fall.

Dialogue: Gill! Don't let me go belly up!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Don't let me go belly up!

Dialogue: You won't go belly up, I promise. You're gonna be okay.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: I'm totally excited. [yawn] Are you excited? [yawn]

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Dory, wake up, wake up. Come on.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: That's not a duck. It's a--pelican! Whooooaaaaah!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No! I didn't come this far to be breakfast!

Speaker: pelican
Dialogue: Hey, hey, Nigel. Heh, would you look at that?

Speaker: pelican
Dialogue: Sun's barely up and already Gerald's had more than he can handle.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Yeah. Reckon somebody oughta help the poor guy.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Well, don't everybody fly off at once.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: All right, Gerald, what is it? Fish got your tongue?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I gotta find my son Nemo!

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Okay, don't make any sudden moves. Hop inside my mouth if you want to live.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Hop in your mouth, huh? And how does that make me live?

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Because I can take you to your son.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: No. I know your son. He's orange, he's got a gimpy fin on one side..

Speaker: gulls
Dialogue: Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine!

Speaker: gulls
Dialogue: Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine!

Speaker: gulls
Dialogue: Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine!

Speaker: gulls
Dialogue: Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine! Mine!

Speaker: bubbles
Dialogue: Aaaah! Too loud! Too loud for me!

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: Find a happy place, find a happy place, find a happy place!

Speaker: barbara
Dialogue: Darla, you're uncle will see you now.

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: All right, let's see those pearly whites.

Speaker: darla
Dialogue: RAAAH! I'm a piranha. They're in the Amazon.

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: And a piranha's a fish, just like your present.

Speaker: darla
Dialogue: [giggling] I get a fishy! Fishy, fishy, fishy!

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: He he he! Must've left your present in the car, sweetie. Ha ha ha ha ha!

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: What's happening? Why is he playing dead?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: He's gonna get flushed down the toilet! He's gonna get outta here!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Oh no, not the trash can!

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: Hey! Hey! I found his dad!

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: What the--!? Darla, sweetie! Look out!

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: Hold still! Nobody's going to hurt you! Oof!

Speaker: darla
Dialogue: Fishy? Fishy! Wake up! Wake up!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Quick! To the top of Mt. Wannahockaloogie!

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: What!? All the animals have gone mad!

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Sharkbait. Tell your dad..I said..hi. Go get 'em.

Speaker: gurgle
Dialogue: Is he gonna be okay, Gill?

Speaker: gill
Dialogue: Don't worry. All drains lead to the ocean.

Speaker: nigel
Dialogue: I'm, I'm so sorry. Truly, I am.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Dory. If it wasn't for you, I never even would have made it here. So, thank you.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Hey! Hey, wait a minute. W-w-wait! Where are you going?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: It's over, Dory. We were too late. Nemo's gone and I'm going home now.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: No..no, you can't! Stop! Please don't go away. Please? No  one's ever stuck with me for so long before. And if you leave, if you leave...I just,  I remember things better with you. I do. Look, P. Sherman, 42..40..2..agh! I remember it, I  do. It's there, I know it is because when I look at you, I can feel it. And I, I look  at you and...I'm home. Please. I don't want them to go away. I don't wanna forget.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Dory, but I do.

Speaker: crab 1
Dialogue: Yeah, that's it fella! Just keep on swimmin', you got that!

Speaker: crab 2
Dialogue: Too right, mate! Oh, Oh! I got a live one here!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Hey, have you seen my dad?

Speaker: crab 2
Dialogue: Gotcha! Hey! Hey! Come back here!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Um, excuse me. Are you all right?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: I don't know where I am! I don't know what's going on, I think I lost somebody but I, I can't remember.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: It's okay, it's okay. I'm looking for someone too. Hey, we can look together.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Dad! Wait a minute, is it your dad or my dad?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Dad! Dad! Oh. S-ss-syl--shi--Sydney. [gasps] 'P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney'.

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Aaaaah! Nemo! It's you! Aaaaaah! You're Nemo!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Oh! You're Nemo! [gasps] You were dead! I saw you! And then I--[gasps], here you are! I found you! You're not dead! And your father--[gasps]! Your father!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: My father!? You know my father!? Where is he!?

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: [gasps] This way! He went this way! Quick!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: Hey! Have you seen an orange fish swim by? It looks just like him!

Speaker: crab 2
Dialogue: Yeah, I saw 'im, bluey! But I'm not tellin' you where he went. And there's no way you're gonna make me!

Speaker: crab
Dialogue: Huh!? Aaaah! All right! I'll talk! I'll talk! He went to the fishing grounds! Aaaaah!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Sorry. Just trying to get home.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Oh, thank goodness! It's all right, son. It's gonna be okay.

Speaker: fish
Dialogue: Turn around! You're going the wrong way! Aaaaaaaaaaah!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Dad! I know what to do!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: We have to tell all the fish to swim down together!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, I am not gonna lose you again!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Dad, there's no time! It's the only way we can save Dory! I can do this!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: You're right. I know you can.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Tell all of the fish to swim down!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Well!? You heard my son! Come on!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: You have to tell everybody to..

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: ..swim down together! Do you understand what I'm saying to you!? Swim down!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Come on! You have to swim down!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: down! Swim down! Swim down! Swim down!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Don't give up! Keep swimming! Just keep swimming!

Speaker: fish
Dialogue: Keep swimming! Keep swimming! Keep swimming!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Come on! Let's get to the bottom! Keep swimming!

Speaker: dory
Dialogue: [singing] Just keep swimming, just keep swimming.

Speaker: fish
Dialogue: Keep swimming! Keep swimming! Keep swimming! Keep swimming! Yay!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Nemo? Nemo? It's okay. Daddy's here, daddy's got you.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: No, no, no. I'm so sorry, Nemo.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Sea turtles? I met one! And he was a hundred and fifty years old.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: 'Cause Sandy Plankton said they only live to be a hundred.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Sandy Plankton? Do you think I would cross the entire ocean and not know as much as Sandy Plankton!?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: He was a hundred and fifty! Not one hundred! Who is this Sandy Plankton who knows everything?

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Time for school! Time for school! Get up! Let's go! Go!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: No, you're not! I did it! Woohoo! Ha ha ha!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Oh! My own son beats me!

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: So just then, the sea cucumber looks over to the mollusk and says : 'with fronds like these, who needs anemones?'!

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: But seriously, Marty, did you really do all the things you say you did?

Speaker: anchor
Dialogue: Oh, we just wanna make sure that our newest member got home safe.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Well, we'll see you next week.

Speaker: chum
Dialogue: Keep up with the program, Dory.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Bye, dad! Oh! Oh, Mr. Ray! Wait. I forgot something.

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: Uh, dad, you can let go now.

Speaker: marlin
Dialogue: Sorry! Now go have an adventure!

Speaker: nemo
Dialogue: See you after school, Dory! Bye, dad!

Speaker: dentist
Dialogue: I don't understand it. Here this thing has a lifetime guarantee and it breaks! Had to clean the tank myself, take all the fish out, put 'em in bags and---where'd the fish go?

Speaker: bloat
Dialogue: Yeah, that's it! You can do it!

Speaker: peach
Dialogue: That's the shortest red light I've ever seen!

Speaker: all
Dialogue: Yay! We did it! Ha ha ha ha ha!
